meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

Alright, let's get this groovy review party started! I'm here to dish out my two cents on Minds Beneath Us, and I promise you won't be disappointed (well, maybe a little).

First off, I gotta give those Noisy Pixel folks credit - their 90% score is no joke! They're all about that sci-fi vibe, and Minds Beneath Us delivers the goods. A haunted dystopian future? Check! Compelling storyline? Double check! Atmospheric visuals? You bet your cyberpunk-loving butt it's got those! But don't get too comfy, folks - there's some clunky save system going on that'll keep you on your toes.

Now, over at Try Hard Guides, they're all about the visual novel experience. And let me tell you, Minds Beneath Us serves up a heart-wrenching story with a side of unique sci-fi concepts to munch on. Fans of VNs and great storytelling are in for a treat!

Digital Chumps gives us 85%, saying that Minds Beneath Us uses "a hell of a lot of good confusion" to get you hooked. Okay, I can dig it! They're onto something with this whole "meaningful choices" thing - even if they're just illusionin' the fact that our choices matter.

Then we've got Gamer Escape with their 80% score and some serious praise for the game's sci-fi exploration of identity, mind, and personal values. I mean, who doesn't love a good think-piece on morality in a corrupt system? Minds Beneath Us keeps it real!

GAMINGbible gets us up to 80% too, saying that this game makes us question our morals (again!) and asks just how far we're willing to go for the greater good. Food for thought, anyone?

The Games Machine gives us a score of 75%, highlighting the weirdo graphics adventure vibes with minimal puzzles but loads of dialogue. I mean, who doesn't love some good ol' fashioned chatter-and-wander gameplay? Minds Beneath Us makes sure you're on your toes (or in this case, on your cyberpunk heels).

So there you have it - a mixed bag of opinions on Minds Beneath Us! But hey, that's what makes life worth living, right? At least, I think that's what Noisy Pixel would say if they were still sipping on their existential sci-fi Kool-Aid. Stay groovy, friends!
